column2: Tally one for me, said the Scarecrow, calmly "What's wrong, my man?" he added, addressing the Soldier.
column3: Tally one for me, said the Scarecrow, calmly "What's wrong, my man?" he added, addressing the Soldier.

column2: The City is conquered!" gasped the Royal Army, who was all out of breath.
column3: The City is conquered!" gasped the Royal Army, who was all out of breath.

column2: This is quite sudden, said the Scarecrow.
column3: This is quite sudden, said the Scarecrow.

column2: Good afternoon, noble parent! he cried, delightedly.
column3: Good afternoon, noble parent! he cried, delightedly.

column2: I'm glad to see you are here.	I'm glad to see you are here.
That terrible Saw-Horse ran away with me."
column3: That terrible Saw Horse ran away with me."

column2: I suspected it, said Tip.
column3: I suspected it, said Tip.

column2: Did you get hurt?	Did you get hurt?
Are you cracked at all?"
column3: Are you cracked at all?"

column2: No, I arrived safely, answered Jack, "and his Majesty has been very kind indeed to me.
column3: No, I arrived safely, answered Jack, "and his Majesty has been very kind indeed to me.

column2: By the way, who has conquered me?
column3: By the way, who has conquered me?

column2: Where can you go? asked Jack Pumpkinhead.
column3: Where can you go? asked Jack Pumpkinhead.

column2: But we also are in danger, said the Pumpkinhead, anxiously.
column3: But we also are in danger, said the Pumpkinhead, anxiously.

column2: If any of these girls understand cooking, my end is not far off!
column3: If any of these girls understand cooking, my end is not far off!

column2: Nonsense! exclaimed the Scarecrow.
column3: Nonsense! exclaimed the Scarecrow.

column2: they're too busy to cook, even if they know how!
column3: they're too busy to cook, even if they know how!

column2: Ah! then you would not be fit to associate with, returned the Scarecrow. "The matter is more serious than I suspected."
column3: Ah! then you would not be fit to associate with, returned the Scarecrow. "The matter is more serious than I suspected."

column2: You, said the Pumpkinhead, gloomily, "are liable to live for many years. My life is necessarily short.
column3: You, said the Pumpkinhead, gloomily, "are liable to live for many years. My life is necessarily short.

column2: There, there!	There, there!
Don't worry," answered the Scarecrow soothingly; "if you'll keep quiet long enough for me to think, I'll try to find some way for us all to escape."
column3: Don't worry," answered the Scarecrow soothingly; "if you'll keep quiet long enough for me to think, I'll try to find some way for us all to escape."

column2: Where is the Saw-Horse you rode here? he asked the Pumpkinhead.
column3: Where is the Saw Horse you rode here? he asked the Pumpkinhead.

column2: It was the only place I could think of your Majesty, added the Soldier, fearing he had made a blunder.
column3: It was the only place I could think of your Majesty, added the Soldier, fearing he had made a blunder.

column2: It pleases me very much, said the Scarecrow.
column3: It pleases me very much, said the Scarecrow.

column2: Has the animal been fed?
column3: Has the animal been fed?

column2: Excellent! cried the Scarecrow.
column3: Excellent! cried the Scarecrow.

column2: Bring the horse here at once.
column3: Bring the horse here at once.

column2: He doesn't seem especially graceful! he remarked, musingly.
column3: He doesn't seem especially graceful! he remarked, musingly.

column2: but I suppose he can run?
column3: but I suppose he can run?

column2: He can't carry four! objected Tip.
column3: He can't carry four! objected Tip.

column2: For, from the ease with which he was conquered, I have little confidence in his powers."
column3: For, from the ease with which he was conquered, I have little confidence in his powers."

column2: I expected this blow said the Soldier, sulkily; "but I can bear it.
column3: I expected this blow said the Soldier, sulkily; "but I can bear it.

column2: Perhaps you are right, observed his Majesty.
column3: Perhaps you are right, observed his Majesty.

column2: But, for my part, not being a soldier, I am fond of danger.	But, for my part, not being a soldier, I am fond of danger.
Now, my boy, you must mount first.
column3: Now, my boy, you must mount first.

column2: Fetch a clothesline, said the King to his Army, "and tie us all together. Then if one falls off we will all fall off."
column3: Fetch a clothesline, said the King to his Army, "and tie us all together. Then if one falls off we will all fall off."

column2: I have to be as careful as you do, said Jack.
column3: I have to be as careful as you do, said Jack.

column2: Not exactly, replied the Scarecrow.
column3: Not exactly, replied the Scarecrow.

column2: Now throw open the gates, commanded the Scarecrow, "and we will make a dash to liberty or to death."
column3: Now throw open the gates, commanded the Scarecrow, "and we will make a dash to liberty or to death."

column2: Now, said Tip to the horse, "you must save us all.
column3: Now, said Tip to the horse, "you must save us all.

column2: Run as fast as you can for the gate of the City, and don't let anything stop you."
column3: Run as fast as you can for the gate of the City, and don't let anything stop you."

column2: Tip got one small prick in his left arm, which smarted for an hour afterward; but the needles had no effect upon the Scarecrow or Jack Pumpkinhead, who never even suspected they were being prodded.
column3: Tip got one small prick in his left arm, which smarted for an hour afterward; but the needles had no effect upon the Scarecrow or Jack Pumpkinhead, who never even suspected they were being prodded.

column2: As for the Saw-Horse, he made a wonderful record upsetting a fruit cart, overturning several meek looking men, and finally bowling over the new Guardian of the Gate--a fussy little fat woman appointed by General Jinjur.
column3: As for the Saw Horse, he made a wonderful record upsetting a fruit cart, overturning several meek looking men, and finally bowling over the new Guardian of the Gate-a fussy little fat woman appointed by General Jinjur.

column2: My straw is all shaking down into my legs.
column3: My straw is all shaking down into my legs.
